Locality: Remnant forest on Centinela Ridge, a collection locality of Calaway Dodson's near settlement called "24 de Mayo", east of Patricia Pilar. Centinela can be reached by driving 4 km E from Patricia Pilar, crossing the rivers Palenque and Bimbe, then turning left (upslope) for ca. 10 km to the high point of road near a schoolhouse. Patricia Pilar itself is on the Santo Domingo de los Colorados to Quevedo highway; ca. 40 km S of Santo Domingo.
Description: Tree, ca. 15 m tall, with immature, pale green, very elongate fruits with a persistent calyx with inconspicuous, blunt, longitudinal ridges. Not the same taxon known as Q. asterolepis at the Rio Palenque Biological Station.

Locality: Small patches of forest along ridge to ca. 1.5 km N of Escuela Fiscal Mixta Centinelas del Pichincha (ca. 10 km as-the-crow-flies SE of Patricia Pilar).
Description: Caulescent, terrestrial plants (one seen as trunk epiphyte), very abundant in wet, primary forest. Stems to ca. 1 m tall, though usually lower. Petiole bases tinged wine-red. Leaves split ca. halfway to base, the venation plainly reticulate. Spathes green externally, the inner one whitish within. Staminodia white, the anthers cream white. Inflorescences exhaling a very rich, fruity odor (as of manzana rosa), in press, the morning after bracts fell (no odor detected that evening).

Locality: Small patches of forest along ridge to ca. 1.5 km N of Escuela Fiscal Mixta Centinelas del Pichincha (ca. 10 km as-the-crow-flies SE of Patricia Pilar).
Description: Trunk epiphyte ca. 2 m above ground in wet, primary forest. Stem ca. 2 cm thick, with persistent, reddish-brown cataphyll fibers. Petiole C-shaped, flattened above, the angles finely acute. Lamina coriaceous, distinctly bicolored, glossy and dark green above, weakly glossy and milky-green below. Peduncles subterete. Spathe basically green, heavily suffused with dull pinkish. Spadix green; fruits (ripe?) white, lilac at apex.

Locality: Centinela; Monta–as de Ila; 13 km E of Patricia Pilar; ca. 54 km S of Santo Domingo; in small remnant patch of forest on ridge top and steep slope just East of pass and ca. 1/2 km N of road.

Description: Terrestrial saporphyte.

Description: Vine, scrambling in open area. Leaves opposite.

Locality: Vicinity of El Centinela, 0.2 km past Escuela Mixta El Centinela, along trail to left of road, exactly 13 km E from main Santo Domingo-Quevedo Highway in Patricia Pilar.
Description: Epiphyte; internodes dark green; petioles sharply C-shaped; blades matte, dark green and velvety above, moderately paler below; midrib narrowly acute, in valleys above, round-raised below; primary lateral veins sunken above, raised below; spathe green spreading; spadix green.

Locality: Vicinity of El Centinela, 0.2 km past Escuela Mixta El Centinela, along trail to left of road, exactly 13 km E from main Santo Domingo-Quevedo Highway in Patricia Pilar.
Description: Epiphyte; internodes short, 2 cm diameter; cataphyll fibers fine, reddish brown, persistent; petioles terete below middle, sharply C-shaped toward apex with faint medial rib; blades moderately coriaceous and stiff, slightly bicolorous, dark green and matte above, weakly glossy below; midrib convex and paler above, obtuse and paler below; inflorescence spreading; peduncle tinged purplish; spathe spreading, purplish, the margins rolled under; spadix dark green; tepals matte; pistils becoming purplish at apex.

Locality: Vicinity of El Centinela, 0.2 km past Escuela Mixta El Centinela, along trail  to left of road, exactly 13 km E from  main Santo Domingo-Quevedo Highway in  Patricia Pilar.
Description: Terrestrial; internodes to 10 cm long but to ca. 1 cm long on sprouts, 1 cm diameter; cataphylls deciduous; petioles sharply C-shaped, deeply sulcate, medium green, weakly glossy; blades thin, dark green and weakly glossy above, moderately paler and matte below; midrib acute and concolorous above, round-raised below; primary lateral veins sunken above, narrowly raised below; sterile.

Locality: Small patches of forest along ridge to ca. 1.5 km N of Escuela Fiscal Mixta Centinelas del Pichincha (ca. 10 km as-the-crow-flies SE of Patricia Pilar).
Description: Trunk epiphyte ca. 1-2 m above ground in primary forest; occasional. Stems rather elongate, to ca. 1.5 cm thick, the epidermis silvery-gray. Cataphylls green, rounded dorsally, deciduous intact. Petioles vaguely pale-stippled, narrowly C-shaped, shallowly channeled above, the margins rounded-obtuse. Lamina subcoriaceous, moderately bicolored, semiglossy above, weakly so below. Midrib convex both sides. Primary lateral veins sunken above, convex below. Tertiary veins weakly visible below, slightly raised. Peduncle finely costate. Spathe and spadix green.

Locality: 9 km E of (11 km by road from) Patricia Pilar (1 km to the E of Escuela Centinelas, a minute settlement forest cleared in 1969), 58 km ENE of Quevedo, on Pan-Am Highway to Santo Domingo de los Colorados.
Description: Epiphyte. Vine climbing up tree. Spadix and spathe green.

Author: Dunal
Locality: (some maps show this in PICHINCHA). 7 km E of (9 km by road from) Patricia Pilar. 1.2 km to the W of Esceula Centinelas, a minute settlement forest cleared in 1969, 58 km ENE of Quevedo, on PanAm Highway to Santo Domingo de los Colorados. Heavily disturbed. Virgin fog, moss-and-epiphyte-enshrouded wet tropical rain forest on steep well-drained slopes and ridges, with buttressed trees to 50-60 m, many medium and small palms and Cyclanthaceae in understory. Cretaceous volcanic diabasic bedrock? Soil clayey?
Description: Corolla white with faint dirty pinkish to violet hue, esp. without, strongly stellate, 39 mm. in diam., lobes 4 mm. wide. Anthers very large, yellow. Fruits bright red-orange, smooth, shiny, 29-34 mm. in diam. (size of a ping pong ball). Giant liana with 8 m. long stem, 3 cm. dbh, trailing over vegetation.

Locality: Ca. 5 km along the road from Patricia Pilar-Centinela, tropical moist forest.
Description: Epiphyte. Leaf dark green, sparkling above, veins impressed; light yellow- green below, veins prominent. Stem light green. Petiole in X-section. Spathe light green, spadix olive-green.

Locality: Centenela, Monta–as de Ila, 12 km E of Patricia Pilar. Virgin rain forest.
Description: Epiphyte. Spathe and spadix green.

Author: Romero
Locality: Remnant forest on Centinela Ridge, a collection locality of Calaway Dodson's near settlement called "24 de Mayo", east of Patricia Pilar.
Description: Small sterile tree, ca. 6 m tall, in gap. Leaves dark green above, rigid. Centinela can be reached by driving 4 km E from Patricia Pilar, crossing the rivers Palenque and Bimbe, then turning left (upslope) for ca. 10 km to the high point of road near a schoolhouse. Patricia Pilar itself is on the Santo Domingo de los Colorados to Quevedo highway, ca. 40 km S of Santo Domingo.

Author: H. Wendl. ex Spruce
CurrentDet: Geonoma cuneata H. Wendl. ex Spruce
Locality: Road Patricia Pilar-La Centinela, km 12. Small forest fragment along stream
Description: Solitary. Stem decumbent, erect part 1 m tall, 4 cm diam. Leaves entire to irregularly split in two segments per side. Sheath 25 cm long, petiole 26 cm long, rachis 64 cm long, blade 85 x 35 cm, bifid. Infructescence erect; peduncle 47 cm long, 7 3 mm thick, green except apically; bract 25 cm long, spike 25 x 1 cm, vine red. Fruits green, elliptical, 10 x 6 mm, maturing yellow

Description: Terrestrial; internodes short, 1.5 cm diameter; petioles terete, narrowly sulcate, dark green, matte; blades thin, matte, moderately bicolorous, dark green and velvety above; midrib acute and concolorous above, round-raised and slightly paler below; primary lateral veins weakly quilted above, narrowly raised below.

Author: Croat
Locality: Vicinity of El Centinela, 0.2 km past Escuela Mixta El Centinela, along trail to left of road, exactly 13 km E from main Santo Domingo-Quevedo Highway in Patricia Pilar.
Description: Terrestrial; internodes gray-green, semiglossy; lower part of cataphylls persisting more or less intact at upper nodes, eventually deciduous; petioles medium green, semiglossy, sharply D-shaped and shallowly sulcate above; blades moderately thin, dark green and weakly glossy above, much paler and matte below; midrib narrowly raised to acute and concolorous above, round-raised below; primary lateral veins narrowly sunken above, narrowly raised below; inflorescence erect; spathe green, spreading; spadix bright golden-yellow, glossy.

Author: (Croat & J. Rodr.) Croat & O. Ortiz
CurrentDet: Anthurium albispadix (Croat & J. Rodr.) Croat & O. Ortiz
Locality: Vicinity of El Centinela, 0.2 km past Escuela Mixta El Centinela, along trail  to left of road, exactly 13 km E from  main Santo Domingo-Quevedo Highway in  Patricia Pilar.
Description: Terrestrial; internodes short, 2-3.5 cm diameter; petioles terete, medium green, semiglossy; blades subcoriaceous, slightly bicolorous, semiglossy; midrib convex and slightly paler above, round-raised and moderately paler below; primary lateral veins weakly sunken above, narrowly riased below; inflorescence immature; spathe green; spadix pale green, semi-glossy.

Author: (G.S. Bunting) Madison
Locality: Vicinity of La Centinela, 0.2 km past Escuela Mixta La Centinela, along trail to left of road, exactly 13 km E from main Santo Domingo-Quevedo Highway in Patricia Pilar
Description: Internodes to 3 cm diameter, moderately short, scurfy brown; petioles terete and matte; sheath incurled, weakly undulate; blades thin, dark green and velvety above, slightly paler and moderately glossy below; midrib and primary lateral veins sunken above, +/- round-raised below; tertiary veins prominently raised below; inflorescences 5 per axil; spathe green on tube, whitish on blade; male flowers orange, (white before anthesis); female flowers cream, fused half their length to spathe.

Author: Schott
Locality: Vicinity of El Centinela, 0.2 km past Escuela Mixta El Centinela, along trail to left of road, exactly 13 km E from main Santo Domingo-Quevedo Highway in Patricia Pilar.
Description: Appressed climber; internodes to 2 cm long, 1 cm diameter; dark green, semiglossy; petioles matte, medium green, weakly glossy; blades thin, dark green and semiglossy above, moderately paler and weakly glossy below; midrib sunken and marginally discolorous above, round-raised below; primary lateral veins sunken above, convex below; tertiary veins prominent below; sterile.

Author: Schott
Locality: Vicinity of El Centinela, 0.2 km past Escuela Mixta El Centinela, along trail to left of road, exactly 13 km E from main Santo Domingo-Quevedo Highway in Patricia Pilar.
Description: Hemi-epiphytic vine; internodes dark green, semiglossy, transversely fissured; petioles obtusely angulate adaxially; blades thinly coriaceous, semiglossy, moderately bicolorous; major veins sunken above, convex below; sterile.

Author: K. Krause
Locality: Vicinity of El Centinela, 0.2 km past Escuela Mixta El Centinela, along trail to left of road, exactly 13 km E from main Santo Domingo-Quevedo Highway in Patricia Pilar.
Description: Terrestrial; internodes gray, obtusely sulcate on one side, moderately glossy; petiole sheath spreading; blades thin, dark green, semiglossy, scarcely bicolorous; midrib broadly convex and concolorous above, narrowly raised and paler below; primary lateral veins weakly sunken above, weakly raised below; minor veins moderately obscure.

Author: Croat & Grayum
Locality: Vicinity of El Centinela, 0.2 km past Escuela Mixta El Centinela, along trail to left of road, exactly 13 km E from main Santo Domingo-Quevedo Highway in Patricia Pilar.
Description: Terrestrial; internodes dark green, matte, slightly flattened on one side; petiolar sheath erect, scarious, sharply sulcate above sheath; blades thin, semiglossy, slightly bicolorous; major veins sunken above; midrib narrowly raised below; primary lateral veins convex below; minor veins visible, not distinct; sterile.

Author: Croat
Locality: Vicinity of El Centinela, 0.2 km past Escuela Mixta El Centinela, along trail to left of road, exactly 13 km E from main Santo Domingo-Quevedo Highway in Patricia Pilar.

Author: Croat
Locality: Vicinity of El Centinela, 0.2 km past Escuela Mixta El Centinela, along trail to left of road, exactly 13 km E from main Santo Domingo-Quevedo Highway in Patricia Pilar.
Description: Terrestrial; internodes to 2 cm long, 1 cm diameter, gray-green, semiglossy; cataphyll fibers pale, persisting at upper nodes, then deciduous; petioles sharply C-shaped, medium green, semiglossy; blades thin, dark green and subvelvety above, moderately paler and matte below; major veins narrowly acute, knife-edged above, acute below; sterile.

Author: Croat
Locality: Vicinity of La Centinela, 0.2 km past Escuela Mixta La Centinela, along trail to left of road, exactly 13 km E from main Santo Domingo-Quevedo Highway in Patricia Pilar.
*GeographicKeywords: Quevedo Highway in Patricia Pilar Santo Domingo
Description: Appressed epiphyte; internodes 3-4 cm long, 3.5 cm diameter, becoming brown, semiglossy, variously fissured; petioles medium green, matte; geniculum sharply sulcate; blades subcoriaceous, dark green and weakly glossy above, conspicuously paler and semiglossy below; midrib narrowly sunken and weakly discolored marginally, thicker than broad below; primary lateral veins weakly quilted-sunken above; convex below; minor veins moderately distinct; unopened spathe creamy, the spadix pink; spadix (post anthesis) pale orange; pistils matte; infructescence pale orange, the pistils loosened and embedded in a gelatinous matrix.

Author: K. Koch & Augustin
Locality: Vicinity of El Centinela, 0.2 km past Escuela Mixta El Centinela, along trail to left of road, exactly 13 km E from main Santo Domingo-Quevedo Highway in Patricia Pilar.
Description: Epiphyte; internodes 1-2 cm long, 2.5 cm diameter; cataphylls tinged reddish, sharply 1-ribbed, the fibers persistent; petioles terete, dark green, coarsely striate, weakly glossy; blades subcoriaceous, semiglossy, moderately bicolorous; midrib flat and concolorous above, convex below; primary lateral veins sunken above, convex below; minor veins moderately distinct, close, fine; sterile.

Author: Croat

Author: Croat
Locality: 0.2 km past Escuela Mixta La Centinela, along trail to left of road, exactly 13 km E from main Santo Domingo-Quevedo Highway in Patricia Pilar.
Description: Epiphyte; internodes short, ca. 1 cm diam.; cataphylls medium brown, persisting moderately intact, eventually fibrous; petioles sharply and shallowly sulcate in apical half, obtusely so in lower half, medium green, matte; blades subcoriaceous, dark green and semiglossy above, moderately paler and semiglossy below; midrib narrowly rounded and paler above, narrowly rounded and weakly paler below; primary lateral veins etched and concolorous above, weakly raised and slightly darker below, about as prominent as the collective veins; spathe pale green, spreading, twisted and often strongly recurled at tip; spadix medium dark green, semiglossy; pollen white.

Locality: Along ridgeline at Centinela 12 km east of Patricia Pilar in Monta–as de Ila.
Description: Flowers wine-red.  Plants common on tree trunks.  Flower in alcohol.

Author: (Dodson) Dodson
Locality: Centinela, Montanas de Ila, 12 km east of Patricia Pilar.
Description: Leaves bronxy-green with white spots. Sepals green, petals white with a red-brown center stripe; lip white with brown margins. Uncommon.

Author: C. Presl
Locality: Centinela, km 12 carretera Patrica Pilar-24 de Mayo, altura de km 47 Santo Domingo-Quevedo. En la cime de las Montanas de IIa.
Description: Hierba hasta 70 cm de alto. Flores y frutos verdes.

Author: Benth.
Locality: El Centinela. 12 Km E of Patricia Pilar on road between Quevedo & Santo Domingo. Tropical wet forest.
Description: Tree 10 m, flowers white. New inflorescence heads enclosed by terminal bract.

Author: O. Berg ex Triana
CurrentDet: Blakea subconnata O. Berg ex Triana
Locality: 12 Km E. of Patricia Pilar on road between Quevedo & Santo Domingo. Tropical wet forest. El Centinela. Province Pichincha.
Description: Shrub 1 m, flowers pinkish white, anthers purple.

Author: Guillaumin
Locality: El Centinela, 12 Km E. of Patricia Pilar on road between Santo Domingo and Quevedo. Tropical wet forest.
Description: Epiphytic aroid, leaves erect, inflorescence slightly curving, pale yellow (9/5), immature; spathe spreading, yellow green (7/7.5); petioles canaliculate on one side.

Author: (Wurdack) Penneys & Almeda
Locality: El Centinela, 12 Km. E. of Patricia Pilar on road between Santo Domingo and Quevedo. Tropical wet forest.
Description: Vine, common, flowers pale yellow; leaves with glands on underside near base.

Author: (Ruiz & Pav.) Borhidi
Locality: El Centinela, 12 Km. E. of Patricia Pilar on road between Santo Domingo and Quevedo. Tropical wet forest.
Description: Shrub 0.7 m, undersides of leaves violet, flowers whitish.

Author: Hoerold
Locality: El Centinela, 12 km E. Of pAtricia Pilar on Road between Santo Domingo And Quevedo. Tropical wet forest.
Description: Epiphytic shrub 1m, calyces orange; corolla red at base and pale green tip.

Author: Croat
Locality: 12 km E of Patricia Pilar, El Centinela

Author: Donn. Sm.
Locality: El Centinela, 12 m E. of Patricia Pilar on road between Santo Domingo and Quevedo. Tropical wet forest.
Description: Epiphyte on fallen tree, flowers greenish white.

Author: Woodson
Locality: El Centinela, 12 km E of Patricia Pilar on road between Santo Domingo & Quevado.
Description: Vine, flowers cream; outside of tube red-tinged.

Author: (Jacq.) P.H. Raven
Locality: Centinela, km 12 carretera Patricia Pilar-24 de Mayo, altura de km 47 Santo Domingo-Quevedo. En la cima de las Montanas de Ila.
Description: Hierba 1 m de alto. Petalos amarillos.

Author: Harling
Locality: Centinela, km 12 carretera Patricia Pilar-24 de Mayo, altura de km 47 Santo Domingo-Quevedo. En la cima de las Montanas de Ila.
Description: Semiepifita. Inflorescencia blanca.

Author: M.A. Jaram. & Callejas
Locality: Centinela, km 12 carretera Patricia Pilar- 24 de Mayo, altura de km 47 Santo Domingo-Quevedo. En al cima de las Montanas de Ila.
Description: 50 cm de alto. Hojas roja verdes en la haz roja-purpura en el envex. Espigas blancas.

Author: Croat
Locality: Centinela, km 12 carretera Patricia Pilar-24 de Mayo, altura de km 47 Santo-Domingo-Quevedo. En la cima de las Montanas de Ila.
Description: Hierba 2.5 cm dbh. Esteril.

Author: Lundell
Locality: Centinela, km 12 carretera Patricia Pilar - 24 de Mayo, altura de km 47 Santo Domingo - Quevedo, en la cima de las Montanas de Ila
Description: Arbol, 8 m, botones blanquecina

Author: L.B. Sm.
Locality: Monta–a de Ila, 12 km E of Patricia Pilar on road to R’o Toachi, near summit.
Description: Epiphyte, fruits brownish, leaves purplish.

Author: H.E. Moore
Locality: Monta–a de Ila, 12 km E of Patricia Pilar on road to R’o Toachi, near summit.
Description: Slender clumped palm 3 m., with pencil-thin stem, inflorescence green

Author: Mansf.
Locality: Monta–a de Ila, 12 km E of Patricia Pilar on road to R’o Toachi, near summit.
Description: Epiphyte, flowers yellow, calyx orange.

Author: (Engl.) Engl.
Locality: El Centinela, ridgetop E of R’o Palenque Science Center.
Description: Terrestrial herb, spathe green.

Author: Diels
Locality: La Corina, 20 km E of Patricia Pilar, 6 km E of La Centinela, mature forest being logged, border with Pichincha.

Author: Standl.
Locality: La Corina, 20 km E of Patricia Pilar, 6 km E of La Centinela, mature forest being logged, border with Pichincha.

Author: Cochrane
Locality: La Corina, 20 km E of Patricia Pilar, 6 km E of La Centinela, mature forest being logged, border with Pichincha.
Description: Treelet 3 m, flowers red-orange, inflorescence racemose, terminal.

Author: (Griggs) H.J.P. Winkl.
Locality: La Corina, 20 km E of Patricia Pilar, 6 km E of La Centinela, mature forest being logged, border with Pichincha.
Description: Coarse herb, 1 m., leaves reddish beneath, single inflorescence erect, bracts brown, shriveled fruits.

Author: Cuatrec.
Locality: La Corina, 20 km E of Patricia Pilar, 6 km E of La Centinela, mature forest being logged, border with Pichincha.

Author: G. Don
Locality: La Corina, 20 km E of Patricia Pilar, 6 km E of La Centinela, mature forest being logged, border with Pichincha.

Author: Trel. & Yunck.
Locality: La Corina, 20 km E of Patricia Pilar, 6 km E of La Centinela, mature forest being logged, border with Pichincha.

Author: H. Karst.
Locality: La Corina, 20 km E of Patricia Pilar, 6 km E of La Centinela, mature forest being logged, border with Pichincha.
Description: Epiphyte, flowers light yellow, leaves red-tipped.

Author: Hook. f.
Locality: La Corina, 20 km E of Patricia Pilar, 6 km E of La Centinela, mature forest being logged, border with Pichincha.

Author: Dodson
Locality: La Corina, 20 km E of Patricia Pilar, 6 km E of La Centinela, mature forest being logged, border with Pichincha.

Author: Triana
Locality: La Corina, 20 km E of Patricia Pilar, 6 km E of La Centinela, mature forest being logged, border with Pichincha.

Author: Regel
Locality: La Corina, 20 km E of Patricia Pilar, 6 km E of La Centinela, mature forest being logged, border with Pichincha.
Description: Epiphytic vine, flowers strongly bilabiate, red, calyx green.

Author: Engl.
Locality: La Corina, 20 km E of Patricia Pilar, 6 km E of La Centinela, mature forest being logged, border with Pichincha.
Description: Epiphyte, spathe green, spadix yellow.

Author: Mez & Sodiro
Locality: Centinela, 12 km E of Patricia Pilar on border with Los R’os, wet forest.
Description: Epiphyte, fruits brown.

Author: (Engl.) Croat & Delannay
Locality: Centinela, 12 km E of Patricia Pilar on border with Los R’os, wet forest.
Description: Erect terrestrial herb, spathe greenish cream, spadix white.

Author: Engl.
Locality: Centinela, 12 km E of Patricia Pilar on border with Los R’os, wet forest.
Description: Epiphyte, spathe green, petiole grooved above.

Author: Croat & Grayum
Locality: Centinela, 12 km E of Patricia Pilar on border with Los R’os, wet forest.
Description: Terrestrial herb, spathe green.

Author: C. DC.
Locality: Centinela, 12 km E of Patricia Pilar on border with Los R’os, wet forest.
Description: Terrestrial herb, inflorescence greenish, forked.

Author: Diels
Locality: Centinela, 12 km E of Patricia Pilar on border with Los R’os, wet forest.
Description: Hemiepiphytic vine, buds yellow, fruits green.

Author: Croat
Locality: Centinela, 12 km E of Patricia Pilar on border with Los R’os, wet forest.
Description: Terrestrial herb 0.5 m, spathe green.

Author: Wurdack
Locality: Centinela, 12 km E of Patricia Pilar on border with Los R’os, wet forest.

Author: Diels
Locality: Centinela, cloud forest along ridge line E of Patricia Pilar.
Description: Hemiepiphytic liana; buds yellow.

Author: Mansf.
Locality: Centinela, cloud forest along ridge line E of Patricia Pilar.

Author: C. DC.
Locality: Centinela, cloud forest along ridge line E of Patricia Pilar.

Author: Guillaumin
Locality: Centinela, cloud forest along ridge line E of Patricia Pilar.
Description: Epiphyte, fruits purple, spathe green.

Author: Engl.
Locality: Centinela, cloud forest along ridge line E of Patricia Pilar.
Description: Epiphyte climber, spathe green, spadix cream, top of petiole flat.

Author: Croat
Locality: Centinela, cloud forest along ridge line E of Patricia Pilar.

Author: Fritsch
Locality: Centinela, cloud forest along ridge line E of Patricia Pilar.
Description: Subepiphytic at base of tree, flowers lavender.

Author: (Wiehler) M.M. Mora & J.L. Clark
CurrentDet: Trichodrymonia hypocyrta (Wiehler) M.M. Mora & J.L. Clark
Locality: Centinela, cloud forest along ridge line E of Patricia Pilar.
Description: Terrestrial; flowers white, calyx red, leaves purplish beneath.

Author: C.V. Morton
Locality: Centinela, cloud forest along ridge line E of Patricia Pilar.

Author: (O.F. Cook & Doyle) R. Bernal
CurrentDet: Wettinia aequalis (O.F. Cook & Doyle) R. Bernal
Locality: Centinela, cloud forest along ridge line E of Patricia Pilar.

Author: Sodiro
Locality: Montanas de Ila, ca. 10 km SE of Patricia Pilar along road to Corina; growing in disturbed foret on hilltop.
Description: Vine, spadix and spathe dark red.

Author: Croat
Locality: Small patches of forest along ridge to ca. 1.5 km N of Escuela Fiscal Mixta Centinelas del Pichincha (ca. 10 km as-the-crow-flies SE of Patricia Pilar).
Description: Common terrestrial plant in disturbed forest, the stems spindly, to ca. 1 m tall. Epidermis of older stems tan. Cataphylls persisting more or less intact. Petioles U-shaped, V-sunken above, the angles acute. Lamina subcoriaceous, weakly bicolored, semiglossy above, matte below. Midrib triangular above, convex below. Primary lateral veins convex above in proximal part of blade, sunken in distal part, convex below. Tertiary veins visible below, slightly raised and darker. Peduncle subterete (obscurely angled). Spathe light green, reflexed, the veins prominulous below. Spadix bright golden-yellow.

Author: (Hieron.) C.F. Reed
Locality: Small patches of forest along ridge to ca. 1.5 km N of Escuela Fiscal Mixta Centinelas del Pichincha (ca. 10 km as-the-crow-flies SE of Patricia Pilar).
Description: Terrestrial in cloud forest on ridge, the rhizome stout, brief. Rachis budding apically. Probably same species as MG 9395, but apex different.

Author: H.E. Moore
Locality: Small patches of forest along ridge to ca. 1.5 km N of Escuela Fiscal Mixta Centinelas del Pichincha (ca. 10 km as-the-crow-flies SE of Patricia Pilar).
Description: Spindly, cespitose palms, occasional in patches of primary forest. Stems to ca. 2 m tall.

Author: Guillaumin
Locality: Small patches of forest along ridge to ca. 1.5 km N of Escuela Fiscal Mixta Centinelas del Pichincha (ca. 10 km as-the-crow-flies SE of Patricia Pilar).
Description: Occasional trunk epiphyte, 1-2 m above ground, in primary forest. Petioles D-shaped, virtually flat above, the angles acute. Lamina coriaceous, moderately bicolored, weakly glossy both sides. Midrib convex both sides. Primary lateral veins sunken above, convex below. Tertiary veins obscure below. Peduncle finely angled. Spathe green; spadix at present stage green. Fruits becoming deep burgundy. Same species as MG 9351.

Author: Croat & Grayum
Locality: Small patches of forest along ridge to ca. 1.5 km N of Escuela Fiscal Mixta Centinelas del Pichincha (ca. 10 km as-the-crow-flies SE of Patricia Pilar).
Description: Rigidly scandent plants, climbing on trunks in patches of primary forest. Epidermis of stems cafe-au-lait, longitudinally wrinkled. Petiole sheath involute, the margins cracking. Sterile collection.

Author: Engl.
Locality: Small patches of forest along ridge to ca. 1.5 km N of Escuela Fiscal Mixta Centinelas del Pichincha (ca. 10 km as-the-crow-flies SE of Patricia Pilar).
Description: Scandent plant on tree in pasture, the fertile stems dangling, erect at apex. Stems ca. 2.5 cm thick, the epidermis dull, grayish. Petioles shallowly D-shaped, flattened above, the angles rounded-obtuse. Leaves coriaceous, virtually concolorous, weakly glossy above, matte below. Midrib flat-raised above, rounded-triangular and slightly paler below. Primary lateral veins weakly sunken above, weakly raised below. Tertiary veins weakly etched above, obscure below. Cataphylls salmon-pinkish, 2-winged, deciduous intact. Peduncle compressed, finely whitish-lineolate. Spathe uniformly greenish-white inside and out. Male portion of spadix and pollen cream- white; female portion pale green.

Author: Engl.
Locality: Small patches of forest along ridge to ca. 1.5 km N of Escuela Fiscal Mixta Centinelas del Pichincha (ca. 10 km as-the-crow-flies SE of Patricia Pilar).
Description: Long-stemmed, subscandent plants in secondary growth at edge of forest. Stems to ca. 1 cm thick, the epidermis on older internodes becoming tannish. Leaves coriaceous, weakly bicolored, semiglossy both sides. Midrib V-sunken above, convex below. Primary lateral veins weakly convex above, weakly sunken below, rather prominent for this genus. Tertiary veins not visible. Peduncle subterete. Spadix white, stipitate.

Locality: Small patches of forest along ridge to ca. 1.5 km N of Escuela Fiscal Mixta Centinelas del Pichincha (ca. 10 km as-the-crow-flies SE of Patricia Pilar).
Description: Stout, loosely appressed-climbing plants (the apical portions free) to ca. 3.5 m above ground in primary forest. Stems to ca. 3 cm thick, the epidermis rough, brownish and transversely cracking. Young stems with raised, longitudinal white streaks. Cataphylls salmon pinkish, rounded dorsally, deciduous intact. Petioles terete, firm, finely whitish-lineolate. Lamina thinly coriaceous, easily tearing, moderately bicolored, semiglossy above, glossy below; margins paler, subhyaline. Midrib convex and paler above, obtusely triangular below. Primary lateral veins sunken above, convex below. Tertiary veins visible below, darker. Peduncle subterete (vaguely compressed), terra cotta, densely whitish-lineolate. Spathe thick-walled, magenta-pink externally (becoming light green at apex), densely whitish-lineolate, deep crimson internally in proximal half, fading to pinkish and ultimately greenish-white distally. Male portion of spadix white; ovaries pale greenish, the stigmas pinkish.

Author: (Baker) Diels
Locality: Small patches of forest along ridge to ca. 1.5 km N of Escuela Fiscal Mixta Centinelas del Pichincha (ca. 10 km as-the-crow-flies SE of Patricia Pilar).
Description: Uncommon terrestrial fern in primary forest on ridge, the rhizome stout, erect. Petiole and rachis subsucculent.

Author: Hook.
Locality: Small patches of forest along ridge to ca. 1.5 km N of Escuela Fiscal Mixta Centinelas del Pichincha (ca. 10 km as-the-crow-flies SE of Patricia Pilar).
Description: Epiphytic on exposed roots and trunk bases in wet primary forest. Petiole and rachis (except wings) glossy black. Rachis prolonged at apex and becoming viviparous.

Author: (Baker) Maxon
Locality: Small patches of forest along ridge to ca. 1.5 km N of Escuela Fiscal Mixta Centinelas del Pichincha (ca. 10 km as-the-crow-flies SE of Patricia Pilar).
Description: Terrestrial fern in wet primary forest on ridge, the rhizome stout, erect. Occasional, but only one seen fertile. Bud never present between proximal pinnae.

Author: Croat
Locality: Small patches of forest along ridge to ca. 1.5 km N of Escuela Fiscal Mixta Centinelas del Pichincha (ca. 10 km as-the-crow-flies SE of Patricia Pilar).
Description: Very rare trunk epiphyte (just one plant seen) ca. 1.5 m above ground in primary forest. Stem rather elongate, ca. 1 cm thick, the epidermis grayish. Cataphylls weathering to short, whitish fibers. Petioles U-shaped, flattened above with vague median raphe, the margins sharply angled. Lamina subcoriaceous, moderately bicolored, semiglossy above, weakly so below. Midrib convex above, narrowly and sharply triangular below. Primary lateral veins sunken above, convex below. Tertiary veins visible and prominulous below. Peduncle rather sharply oligocostate. Spathe green; spadix lemon-yellow.

Author: Killip
Locality: Small patches of forest along ridge to ca. 1.5 km N of Escuela Fiscal Mixta Centinelas del Pichincha (ca. 10 km as-the-crow-flies SE of Patricia Pilar).
Description: Scandent plant on tree trunks in wet, primary forest, ascending to at least 3 m, the main stems brittle and woody, with divergent, flat sprays of foliage. New growth pinkish. Leaf veins prominulous above. Flowers greenish white.

Author: (Hieron.) C.F. Reed
Locality: Small patches of forest along ridge to ca. 1.5 km N of Escuela Fiscal Mixta Centinelas del Pichincha (ca. 10 km as-the-crow-flies SE of Patricia Pilar).
Description: Terrestrial fern, rare in wet, primary forest; rhizome stout, brief. Petioles deep burnished walnut toward base. Rachis budding apically.

Author: Linden & AndrŽ
Locality: Small patches of forest along ridge to ca. 1.5 km N of Escuela Fiscal Mixta Centinelas del Pichincha (ca. 10 km as-the-crow-flies SE of Patricia Pilar).
Description: Low, terrestrial plants, the stems decumbent at base, occasional in wet primary forest. Stem ca. 2 cm thick, olive-green, semiglossy. Petiole sheath finely pluricostate externally. Lamina subcoriaceous, moderately bicolored (deep green above, olive-green below with whitish-mealy indumentum), semiglossy above, matte below. Midrib flat-raised above, low-convex below. Primary lateral veins deeply snken above, prominently raised below. Tertiary veins obscure below. Spathe uniformly green.

Author: Croat
Locality: Small patches of forest along ridge to ca. 1.5 km N of Escuela Fiscal Mixta Centinelas del Pichincha (ca. 10 km as-the-crow-flies SE of Patricia Pilar).
Description: Occasional low trunk epiphyte, to ca. 1 m above ground, in wet primary forest. Stem stout, the cataphylls persistent as reddish-brown fibers. Petiole D-shaped, flat above (with obscure to pronounced median ridge distally), the margins sharply angled. Lamina coriaceous, weakly bicolored, weakly glossy both sides. Peduncle with 3 more or less sharp angles. Spathe green, reflexed. Spadix olive-green.

Author: K. Krause
Locality: Small patches of forest along ridge to ca. 1.5 km N of Escuela Fiscal Mixta Centinelas del Pichincha (ca. 10 km as-the-crow-flies SE of Patricia Pilar).
Description: Scandent plants, occasional in disturbed areas of primary forest in crowns of understory trees. Stem to ca. 1.5 cm thick, the epidermis becoming dull gray brown. Petiole sheaths greenish roughened-lenticellate externally, asymmetrically auriculate distally. Petiole beyond sheath D-shaped, channeled above, the margins acute. Lamina subcoriaceous, weakly bicolored, glossy above, semiglossy below. Tertiary veins slightly etched above. Sterile collection.

Author: Sodiro
Locality: Small patches of forest along ridge to ca. 1.5 km N of Escuela Fiscal Mixta Centinelas del Pichincha (ca. 10 km as-the-crow-flies SE of Patricia Pilar).
Description: Terrestrial plants, occasional in disturbed sites in primary forest, the stems to ca. 0.5 m tall, 2 cm thick. Cataphylls persisting as fibers. Cataphylls, peduncles and base of petioles deep maroon. Petioles C- shaped, channeled above, the margins rounded to (distally) rounded-obtuse. Lamina subcoriaceous, moderately bicolored, weakly glossy above, matte below. Midrib and primary lateral veins narrowly and sharply triangular above, less sharply so below. Tertiary veins visible and slightly raised below. Peduncle terete; spathe green, heavily maroon-suffused below. Spadix green, becoming arching.

Author: Liebm.
Locality: Small patches of forest along ridge to ca. 1.5 km N of Escuela Fiscal Mixta Centinelas del Pichincha (ca. 10 km as-the-crow-flies SE of Patricia Pilar).
Description: Scandent plants climbing to at least 5 m on trunk in primary forest, the fertile stems divergent. Stems ca. 1 cm thick, dull brownish, remotely lenticellate- roughened, transversely cracking. Petioles and peduncles also lenticellate-roughened. Lamina thin- chartaceous, virtually concolorous, weakly glossy both sides. Peduncle D-shaped, flattened on one side with the margins rounded-obtuse. Spathe in fruit becoming greenish-orange and lenticellate-roughened externally. Ripe fruits orange.

Author: Schott
Locality: Small patches of forest along ridge to ca. 1.5 km N of Escuela Fiscal Mixta Centinelas del Pichincha (ca. 10 km as-the-crow-flies SE of Patricia Pilar).
Description: Rare plant (only one seen) in primary forest, growing near ground. Stem ca. 2.5 cm thick, the cataphylls weathering to whitish fibers. Petiole D-shaped, weakly channeled above, the margins rounded-obtuse. Lamina thinly coriaceous, moderately bicolored, semiglossy above, weakly so below. Midrib convex both sides. Primary lateral veins convex above in proximal part of leaf, sunken distally, convex below. Tertiary veins visible below, slightly darker. Peduncle terete. Spathe basically green, with pinkish suffusion especially above and along margins below. Spadix bright yellow.

Author: Engl.
Locality: Small patches of forest along ridge to ca. 1.5 km N of Escuela Fiscal Mixta Centinelas del Pichincha (ca. 10 km as-the-crow-flies SE of Patricia Pilar).
Description: Terrestrial or briefly appressed climbing on trunk bases, common at edges of primary forest. Stem to ca. 3 cm thick, the epidermis whitish and soft. Cataphylls green, dorsally rounded, weathering to fibrous mats. Petioles and peduncle vaguely pale-stippled; petioles D-shaped, flattened above, the margins strongly angled. Lamina thinly coriaceous, slightly chartaceous, with rugose appearance. Midrib sharply triangular above, C-shaped below. Primary lateral veins sunken above (except some veins of basal lobes, which are sharply raised), C-shaped (in basal lobes) to convex below. Tertiary veins prominulous below. Peduncle subterete. Spathe and spadix green.

Author: (Hook.) Lellinger
Locality: Small patches of forest along ridge to ca. 1.5 km N of Escuela Fiscal Mixta Centinelas del Pichincha (ca. 10 km as-the-crow-flies SE of Patricia Pilar).
Description: Low epiphyte on tree in pasture. Sori clearly discrete, a feature I have never seen in Costa Rican material.

Author: Lam.
Locality: Small patches of forest along ridge to ca. 1.5 km N of Escuela Fiscal Mixta Centinelas del Pichincha (ca. 10 km as-the-crow-flies SE of Patricia Pilar).
Description: Low trunk epiphyte in wet primary forest.

Author: Hammel & G.J. Wilder
Locality: Small patches of forest along ridge to ca. 1.5 km N of Escuela Fiscal Mixta Centinelas del Pichincha (ca. 10 km as-the-crow-flies SE of Patricia Pilar).
Description: Briefly caulescent, terrestrial plants, locally common in wet, primary forest. Leaves split ca. halfway to base. Spathes greenish-white. Spadix becoming yellowish-green.

Author: Engl.
Locality: Small patches of forest along ridge to ca. 1.5 km N of Escuela Fiscal Mixta Centinelas del Pichincha (ca. 10 km as-the-crow-flies SE of Patricia Pilar).
Description: Appressed-climbing trunk epiphytes, fertile ca. 2 m above ground, occasional in wet, primary forest. Stem ca. 1.5 cm thick, densely clothed with persistent, whitish cataphyll fibers. Cataphylls rounded dorsally, yellow-green. Petiole narrowly U-shaped, channeled above, the margins acute. Lamina thinly coriaceous, moderately bicolored, weakly glossy both sides. Midrib sunken above and slightly paler, convex below; primary lateral veins sunken above, convex below and slightly darker. Tertiary veins visible below, slightly darker. Peduncle subterete, with longitudinal lenticellate roughenings. Spathe green externally in basal half, paler above, uniformly greenish-white within. Male portion of spadix white; female portion cream.

Author: Sodiro
Locality: Small patches of forest along ridge to ca. 1.5 km N of Escuela Fiscal Mixta Centinelas del Pichincha (ca. 10 km as-the-crow-flies SE of Patricia Pilar).
Description: Trunk epiphyte, common in wet, primary forest. Stem stout, clothed with reddish-brown cataphyll fibers. Petiole subterete distally, irregularly angled below. Lamina subcoriaceous, moderately bicolored, semiglossy above, matte below. Midrib convex both sides. Primary lateral veins sunken above (except main veins of lobes convex), convex below. Tertiary veins visible below, darker. Peduncle irregularly angled. Spathe pale greenish, reflexed. Spadix (broken off) deep magenta-red.

Author: K. Krause
Locality: Small patches of forest along ridge to ca. 1.5 km N of Escuela Fiscal Mixta Centinelas del Pichincha (ca. 10 km as-the-crow-flies SE of Patricia Pilar).
Description: Scandent plants, occasional at edge of forest. Stems ca. 1 cm thick, dull brownish-gray. Petiole sheaths greenish-lenticellate, asymmetrically auriculate distally, involute basally. Petiole beyond sheath D-shaped, channeled above, the margins rounded obtuse. Lamina thinly coriaceous, virtually concolorous, weakly glossy both sides. Sterile collection.

Author: (H. Wendl. ex Burret) H.E. Moore
CurrentDet: Prestoea decurrens (H. Wendl. ex Burret) H.E. Moore
Locality: Small patches of forest along ridge to ca. 1.5 km N of Escuela Fiscal Mixta Centinelas del Pichincha (ca. 10 km as-the-crow-flies SE of Patricia Pilar).
Description: Sparingly cespitose palms, the trunks 2-2.5 m tall, occasional in wet, primary forest. Leaves 3-4 per crown, to ca. 2 m long, with 38-40 pinnae per side. Secondary veins sunken above, prominulous below. Petiole and rachis brownish-scurfy. Peduncle and inflorescence axes pinkish-tinged (darker toward base). Flowers nearly white.

Author: Schott
Locality: Small patches of forest along ridge to ca. 1.5 km N of Escuela Fiscal Mixta Centinelas del Pichincha (ca. 10 km as-the-crow-flies SE of Patricia Pilar).
Description: Subscandent trunk epiphytes, fertile ca. 1.5-2 m above ground, rather common in wet, primary forest. Stems to ca. 1 cm thick, the epidermis silvery-gray. Cataphylls weathering to semi-persistent, whitish fibers. Petioles D-shaped, channeled above (with vague median raphe distally), the margins acute. Lamina thinly coriaceous, moderately bicolored, weakly glossy both sides. Midrib bluntly triangular above, convex and slightly paler below. Primary lateral veins sunken above, convex below. Tertiary veins visible below, darker. Peduncle finely pluricostate. Spathe light green, the venation darker. Spadix olive-green.

Author: Hammel
Locality: Centinela; Monta–as de Ila; 13 km E of Patricia Pilar; ca. 54 km S of Santo Domingo; in small remnant patch of forest on ridge top and steep slope just East of pass and ca. 1/2 km N of road.
Description: Shrub to 2.5 m; common on ridge in forest; latex clear; leaves satiny above dull below; plants with very few leaves as if deciduous; petals pale yellow, relatively thick, fleshy; staminate. photo

Author: Hammel

B. Hammel Dec. 1986 a white covering and also a white aril; fruits burgundy within; stigmas 4. photo 1 T

Locality: Virgin fog, moss and epiphyte enshrouded wet tropical rain forest on steep well drained slopes and ridges, with buttresed trees to 50 to 60 meters many medium and small palms and cyclanthaceae in under story. Soil clayey? 9 km East of (11 km by road from) Patricia Pilar (1 km to the East of Escuela Centinelas, a minute settlement forest cleared in 1969), 58 ikm ENE of Quevedo, on PanAm Highway to Santo Domingo de los colorados.
Description: Small understory tree to 8 meters at least. Flowers as if made of wax, light lemon yellow, top half when open amber. Ped. orange.

Author: Sodiro

Virgin fog, moss/epiphyte enshrouded wet tropical rain forest on steep, well-drained slopes and ridges, with buttressed trees to 50-60 m, many medium and small palms and Cyclanthaceae in understory. Cretaceous volcanic diabasic bedrock? Soil clayey?
Description: Stem 5 cm at base where beginning to rot and 7 cm near top. Climbing epiphyte high on trees Gigantic leaves, petioles 1-1.2 m, round in cross section. Spathe light green, spadix infl. +/- reddish maroon. Stems 60 cm long, spirally very knobby. The bases of the leaves one on top of others. 8 leaves/plant.

Author: Croat
Locality: Monta–as de Ila, Centinela. Collected as Dodson s.n.; Selby Accession # 76-0091-035.
Description: Stem creeping to 1.2 m, with adventitious roots to 1 m; leaves glossy; midvein flat above, raised rounded and brownish abaxially; petiole rounded X-sec.; peduncle and lower spathe flattened dorsiventrally; spathe greenish-yellow suffused with orange apically outside, white inside; spadix with green flowers basally, white above; anthers/filaments exserted upper portion; fragrance of citrus.

Author: H.E. Moore
Locality: Centenela, Monta–as de Ila, 12 km E of Patricia Pilar. Virgin rain forest.
Description: Stems single, 5 m tall, smooth, unarmed, diam.: 8 cm, at base, medium part 7-8 cm, at top 6.5 cm, leaf scars almost invisible. Stiltroots present, 10-15 cm high. No crown-shaft present. Number of mature leaves 15. Petiole ca 0.5 m long, with reddish brown bases. Leaf-blade ca 1.5 m long. Number of inflorescences 7, erect, axillary to lower leaves, almost hidden. Immature fruit yellow.

Author: (Burret) R. Bernal
Locality: Centenela, Monta–as de Ila, 12 km E of Patricia Pilar. Virgin rain forest.
Description: Stems single, ca 15 m tall, smooth, unarmed, diameter: at base ca 12 cm, in median part ca 10 cm, at top ca 13 cm. Stiltroots, ca 30 cm high. Crown-shafts ca 1.2 m long, glaucous. Number of mature leaves 5. Petiole 0.4 cm long. Leaf-blade ca 2 m long. Number of inflorescences 3, pendent. Spathes reddish-brown, violet tinted. Immature fruits brown.

Locality: La Centinela, E of Patricia Pilar, last remnants of humid forest along road just below antennae on summit.
Description: Sparsely branched tree ca. 3 m tall. Leaves dark green above, paler beneath, stipular ligules wide, divided, flat on back. Inflorescence axes with short, light indument, primary axis short, secondary axes 6 or 7, heads spherical, flowers at anthesis with deep reddish purple corollas, calyx rim brown, disc white, filaments anthers cream white, anthers deep purple, unopened styles brownish purple, disc turning pinkish purple as flowers enter female receptive stage, immature fruits with ovary pale green, covered with dense whitish indument, calyx rim dark purple, disc reddish purple, styles dark purple, united in the basal half. Photos, DNA.

Author: (Harms) Lowry, G.M. Plunkett & M.M. Mora
CurrentDet: Sciodaphyllum lasiogyne (Harms) Lowry, G.M. Plunkett & M.M. Mora
Locality: La Centinela, E of Patricia Pilar, remnant humid forest along road, ca. 1 km before the antennae located on the summit.
Description: Unbranched treelet ca. 1.5 m tall. Leaves dark green above, paler beneath. Inflorescence with short primary axis, secondary axes 6, totally obscured by nearly mature fruits, heads spherical, ovary orange-pink, with short, tawny indument, calyx rim with 5 teeth, disc pinkish purple, styles slightly lighter, free to the base. Photos, DNA.

Author: (Mansf.) J.L. Clark
Locality: Montanas de Ila; sub-cloud fores, exposure toward the Pacific.
Description: Rambling plant to 2-3 meters long; stem brownish; leaves on undersides light green suffused with pink; bracts, pedicels and Calyces green flushed with red; corolla cream-yellow; immature fruit yellow green flushed with orange. Spirit collection at SEL.

Author: Wiehler
Locality: Montanas de Ila; sub-cloud fores, exposure toward the Pacific.
Description: Typical; calyx lobes pale yellow, flushed with pink; walves of fruit pale yellow inside & out. Spirit collection at SEL.

Author: H. Karst.
Locality: Montanas de Ila; sub-cloud fores, exposure toward the Pacific.
Description: Translucent leaf tips, wider than usual; bracts & calyx with moroon nidvein; berry deep maroon Wiehler live accession W-3385. Spirit collection at SEL.

Author: (Hook.) Hanst.
Locality: Montanas de Ila; sub-cloud forest, exposure toward the Pacific.
Description: Leaves leathery, pale green below with red-suffused veins; pedicels & calyx lobes rose; corolla deep maroon. Spirit collection at SEL.

Author: H. Karst.
Locality: Montanas de Ila; sub-cloud fores, exposure toward the Pacific.
Description: Plants to 2 1/2 ft; leaves green above, green flushed red below, no red tips or windows; bracts pale green; pedicels & calyx red or calyxtips ending in yellow or chartreuse; colrolla cream distally, proximally chartreuse; lower lobes marked with maroon. Spirit collections at SEL.

Author: (Wiehler) L.E. Skog
Locality: Monta–as de Ila: El Centinela, cloud forest on W slope. Live cuttings of sterile coll. C.H. Dodson 6100, 30 May 1976 Cult. at MSBG, greenhouse acc. #W@-2247
Description: Epiphyte on tree trunk. Leaves with red margins, tips, and blotches below; calyx lobes and bracts red or orange spotted with red; corolla lemon yellow, the limb face cream-white. Berry pointed, white.

Author: G.H. Zhu
Locality: Cultivated in greenhouse at the Missouri Botanical Garden. Originally collected by Dodson at Centinela. Received from Selby Botanical Garden (No. 78-2173). Voucher also Christenson 1154 (SEL).
Description: Tuber rounded, brownish, 6 cm diam., 4.2 cm thick, smooth underneath, a few tubercles (1 cm diam.) with many young buds, roots many on +/- flatted top, reddish, up to 0.5 cm diam. roots. Petiole 1.65 m long, 3.5 cm diam. near the base, 1.8 cm at apex; dark olive-green blotched pale green, areas immediately above protuberances on lower part, smooth on upper part. Leaf blade 3 parts, not confluent near the base, medial section 55 cm long, the lateral ones somewhat longer, 60 cm long; rachises naked near petiole.

Author: G.H. Zhu
Locality: Cultivated plant at the Missouri Botanical Garden greenhouse. Collected by Dodson at Centinela.
Description: Same as Zhu 1453 and Selby 78-2173. Petiole purplish tinged green, mottled with white areas which turn wider near apex, smooth, slightly warty near the base, 1 m long, 2.5 cm diam. at base, 1.5 cm diam. at apex. Rachis green, sometimes mottled with pale green stripes, 17 cm long from petiole to first branch for mid section, 8 cm long for lateral sections. Blade 50 cm long, 80 cm wide; midrib and major veins C-shaped sunken above, round-raised and paler below, green on both sides. Terminal segments 18 cm long, 9 cm wide, deeply bilobed or trilobed with one or two acuminate apexes.

Author: Hoerold
Locality: Cloud forest on western slope. Area of virgin forest just being logged. Km 12 rd from Patricia Pilar to 24 de Mayo Monta–as de IIa.
Description: Epiphytic shrub in tree top. Calyx & pedicels orange, corolla orange, petal tips green.

Dearden, Cairns, Australia; petioles to 3.5 cm diameter, +/- black with pale yellow-green bands transversely to diagonally oriented; blades thin, moderately bicolorous; veins mostly sunken above, raised below; midvein +/- round-raised; rachis round-raised, medium green with paler mottling; sterile.
